div.head: Reminder: how does processing of Simple work
div.p:
The model (known informally as the Rahtz Rationale) assumes a workflow with three parts, and three distinct roles, to create a digital edition from a TEI text:
an editor manages the text integrity, makes the high-level output decisions. These fall into two parts
Structural descriptions, eg should the original or corrected version be displayed by default, or is this a block level or inline component
Indications of appearance (titles are in italics).
a designer creates the output envelope (for example, and book layout using InDesign, or a web site using Drupal), making decisions in conjunction with the editor (use Garamond font throughout or every page must show the departmental logo)
a programmer takes the editor's specification, and the TEI text(s), and creates the input for the designer to make the output.

TEI Simple schema ODD contains instructions for intended processing of TEI Simple elements
instructions are simple XML fragments stating which task from a limited TEI Simple function library should be executed when processing that element
multiple processing instructions may occur to define expected behaviour in various contexts or output formats
Processing Engine is able to transform TEI Simple source documents into output format(s) according to processing instructions from TEI Simple ODD

div.head: Necessary changes to TEI
div.p: TEI ODD language needs to be extended with following elements and attributes (proposal pending consideration by TEI Council):

list.item: model behaviour (specifies the actions to undertake), predicate (circumstances where this rule applies), output (output for which rule applies), useSourceRendition (should processing take into account original rendition))
modelSequence (groups sequences of tasks that are to be executed)
modelGrp (groups models and modelSequences for readability and conciseness
rendition (specifies the formatting of the output)

div.head: PE implementation
div.p: As a proof of concept an implementation of PE and Simple function library has been created in XSLT. It consists of XSLT stylesheets suite that generate transform stylesheets based on processing models from TEI Simple ODD.

div.head: The Performance Indicator
div.p:
The aim is to be able to show for a given text
Whether it claims to conform to the TEI Simple view of the world
How it matches up against various encoding criteria
Which directions it has gone in
The idea is that one can browse a corpus of texts and quickly filter on the basis of encoding (cf )
